column2: c1st20th, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Gunshot wound to brain RVN 1969.  No seizuresfor 15 years.  Stopped Dilantin and had gran mal 2 yrs later.  Dr prescribed tegrital had gran mal after 1 month w/new medication.   I'm back on Dilantin and have not had a gran mal for 25 years.  Important to have your dilantin levels checked ever 6 months.  Bleeding gums can be reduced w/soft toothbrush, brushing min twice daily.  Dose has varied between 300 and 500 mg daily.

column9: This med has decreased my seizures greatly, I am also currently on Zonisimide for partial seizures.  I previously trid Keppra, Depekote, Tegritol, Trileptol, Zongran none of which I could stand.  Either they didn't work or they had terrible side effects.  This med IS NOT PERFECT, my levels have gone up and down.  The last time my levels went up my allergies were bothering me badly and I missed the sighns until the level got to 50.9.  All meds have side effects but the side effects of Dilantin I can tolerate for the most part.  My only gripes are the up and down levels and the dental problems.

column2: owlsong, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I sarted taking dilantin early in the year 2009... i had been having seizures that began as absence and grew into grand mal... the dilantin make me sick to my stomache, dizzy, unable to focus, so i asked to be switched to another drug... oh, i forgot the horrivle reacurring dream after that first day in the hospital IV'd 1000 mgs... so they added depakote to my meds...dream left... worse things came.. working up to 1000 mgs while i was still on dilantin... got up to 500 and was unble to function, slurred speach, could not get out of bed,was suicidal, sick, itching,plus, i was still having seizures this whole time.. the more meds the worse and more frequent they became. I insisted they get me off these meds, so i was put on a sceduale to wean off.  After getting off the depakote i felt better and seizures slowed down... but was still on my dilantin... and still not at at well..anxiety, fear, crying jags. now i have been off of both drugs a few days and have horrible mouth pain. Other withdrawl symptoms have been anxiety, fear, shaking, tremors and still havinf seizures, but milder and less often..... I will be seeking other more natural ways of getting my seizures to stop.... i just don't trust these drugs. I am wondering who slse has had such a horrible experience?

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken three different types of medication for my Epilepsy, Dilantin 100mg kaps, Dilantin 30 mg Kaps, Those are taken together for me, Before that, I was taking Kepra 1000mg, and Before that I was taking Depakote 500 mg.  When I first started taking the depakote, I was okay, and everything was fine, but for some reason I decided to do some research on the medicine and found out that it can cause Pancriatitis (not sure how that is spelled), so I went and got that changed to Kepra, because I wasn't only scared of getting sick more because of the medicine, but I also wanted to have children.  While taking Kepra, I was still having the seizures, so, I figured, best for me to get my meds changed again.  When I first started taking Dilantin, I was okay, but, about a month or two after I started taking this medicine, I started having petite mals again, which is why I had to get my meds upped.  I am still really shakey, and I have a hard time standing because of that.  I am not sure if this medication is working for me either.
